ags:resource.dc:title: Zmeny vlhkosti pôdy spôsobené hnojením, osevným postupom a ročníkom

dc:title.dcterms:alternative: Changes of soil moisture caused by fertilisation

dc:creator.ags:creatorCorporate: Slovak University of Agriculture, Nitra, Slovak Republic

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Dry malter production and actual soil moisture were evaluated in field experiment in 2013-2014. Two different crop rotations and three fertilisation regimes were investigated. NPK fertilisation was the source of significantly the highest dry malter production in experiment. Assessment of Azotobag fertilizer showed significantly higher dry matter production than the unfertilized control plot, but it was not as effective as NPK fertilisation. Difference between Azotobag and NPK was also significant. Actual soi! moisture was significantly higher in 2014 than in 2013. From the point of view of crop rotation, soil moisture was higher in crop rotation I. In general NPK fertilisation produced the highest amount of dry matter but soil moisture decreased the most, which was related to the highest water consumption by crops. Azotobag treatment with lower production of dry matter saved the soil moisture the most effective in all of the sampling depths.
